problem: Write a function which returns whether a list is lexicographically smaller than another list.
model:
$precedes :: [Int] -> [Int] -> Bool
$precedes [] s' = True
$precedes (c : cs) (c' : cs')
| c < c' = True
| c == c' = $precedes cs cs'
$precedes s s' = False
examples:
Input: mother father. Output: False.
Input: man woman. Output: True.

wrongExpression.message: Don't use head. Instead, use pattern matching.
Don't use tail. Instead, use pattern matching.

wrongPatterns.message: For a list with no elements, there will not be 2 elements the same!
